page.title: 08A LIFE TIME IN MARLBOROUGH
page.content:
A Fourteen year old looks back
Ever since the age of three I have looked forward to the Mop fair and carnival week. It is the only time Marlborough as a whole goes out and enjoys itself. I'm not sure whether Marlborough has changed, but it must have done. The high street hasn't really changed, a new Ramsbury Building Society Office has appeared and there has been a public outcry over a few more white lines on the road; I hardly notice they are there. When term starts the population gains almost a thousand as Marlborough College boys and girls flock back. Even the mayor teaches at Marlborough with a foot in each camp. Occasionally a shop changes hands, but really Marlborough has not changed a lot.
